reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Investing for impact against Tuberculosis and HIV

description.narrative: South Africa - TB/HIV - Networking HIV and AIDS Community of Southern Africa NPC - NACOSA. This program has the following goals: Accelerate prevention to reduce new HIV and TB infections and STIs. Reduce morbidity and mortality by providing treatment, care and adherence support for all. Reach all key and vulnerable populations with customised and targeted interventions. Address the social and structural drivers of HIV, TB and STIs, and lin these effort to the National Development Plan. Ground the response to HIV, TB and STIs in human rights principles and approaches. Promote leadership and shared accountability for sustainable response to HIV, TB and STIs. Mobilise resources and maximise efficiencies to support the achievment of NSP goals and ensure a sustainable approach. Strengthen strategic information to drive progress towards achievement of NSP goals. The objectives of this program are: Reduce new HIV infections to less than 100,000 by 2022 through combination prevention interventions. Implement the 95-95-95 strategy for HIV. Increase engagment, collaboration and advocacy of key and vulnerable populations in the development and implementation of social and health support activities. To provide an enabling environment to increase access to health services by key and vulnerable populations. Implement social and behaviour change programmes to address key drivers of the epidemic and build social cohesion. Implement economic strengthening programmes with a focus on youth and sex workers in priority focus districts. Promote an environment that enables and protects human and legal rights and prevents stigma and discrimination. Strengthen AIDS Councils to provide effective co-ordination and leadership of all stakeholders for shared accountability in the implementation of the NSP. Improve efficiency and mobilise sufficient resources to achieve the goals, objective and targets of the NSP. Optimise routinely collected strategic health information for data utilisation in decision making

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for ZAF-C-NACOSA
Number of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) using PrEP
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - individual and/or smaller group level interventions
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers using PrEP in priority sex workers PrEP populations
Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
CSS-Other 1: Percentage of CSOs capacitated through the program that successfully attracted a small grant (any donor) and has begun implementation
YP-Other 1: Percentage of eligible other vulnerable populations who initiated oral antiretroviral PrEP during the reporting period
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) reached with HIV prevention programs- defined package of services
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of people newly diagnosed with HIV initiated on ART
Number of community based organizations that received a pre-defined package of training
Percentage of newly diagnosed people linked to HIV care (individual linkage)
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - individual and/or smaller group level interventions
YP-other-1: Percentage of young people aged 10–24 years reached by life skills–based HIV education in and out of schools
CRS-Other 2: Percentage of MDIPs that include the needs and priorities of key and vulnerable populations (MSM, SW, AGYW and TG)
YP-other 2: Percentage of young people aged 10-24 years that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
HIV-Other 2: Percentage of AGYW who receive economic strengthening based on an agreed package
CRS-Other 1: Percentage of CSOs with capacity development plans implemented
Percentage of young people aged 10-24 years attending school reached by compehensive sexuality education and/or life skills-based HIV education in schools
